comment: U.S. economic indicators from Federal Reserve (FRED), Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA), and Treasury Department. Includes employment statistics, inflation metrics, GDP components, interest rates, regional economic data, and over 800,000 time series from FRED. Enables macroeconomic analysis, economic forecasting, policy research, and cross-domain correlation with geographic and demographic data.

partitionedTables.name: employment_statistics
partitionedTables.comment: U.S. employment and unemployment statistics from BLS including national unemployment rate, labor force participation, job openings, and employment by sector. Updated monthly with seasonal adjustments.

columns.name: series_id
columns.comment: BLS series identifier (e.g., 'LNS14000000' for unemployment rate)

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Employment statistic value (e.g., unemployment rate as percentage)

partitionedTables.name: inflation_metrics
partitionedTables.comment: Consumer Price Index (CPI) and Producer Price Index (PPI) data tracking inflation across different categories of goods and services. Includes urban, regional, and sector-specific inflation rates.

columns.name: index_type
columns.comment: Price index type (CPI=Consumer Price Index, PPI=Producer Price Index)

columns.name: item_code
columns.comment: BLS item code identifying specific goods/services category

columns.name: area_code
columns.comment: BLS area code (e.g., 'U'=U.S. city average, regional codes)

columns.name: percent_change_month
columns.comment: Month-over-month percentage change in price index

columns.name: percent_change_year
columns.comment: Year-over-year percentage change in price index

columns.name: area_name
columns.comment: Geographic area name (e.g., 'U.S. City Average', 'Los Angeles')

columns.name: seasonally_adjusted
columns.comment: Whether price index is seasonally adjusted

partitionedTables.name: regional_cpi
partitionedTables.comment: Consumer Price Index for 4 U.S. Census regions (Northeast, Midwest, South, West). Enables regional inflation comparisons and analysis of cost-of-living differences across major geographic areas.

partitionedTables.name: metro_cpi
partitionedTables.comment: Consumer Price Index for 27 major U.S. metropolitan areas including NYC, LA, Chicago, Houston, Phoenix, and others. Critical for understanding local cost-of-living variations and metro-specific inflation trends.

partitionedTables.name: state_industry
partitionedTables.comment: Employment by industry sector for all 51 U.S. jurisdictions (50 states + DC) across 22 NAICS supersector codes. Includes total nonfarm employment, private sector employment, and breakdowns by major industry categories like manufacturing, construction, retail, healthcare, and government. Enables state-level industry analysis and cross-state economic comparisons.

partitionedTables.name: state_wages
partitionedTables.comment: Average weekly wages for all 51 U.S. jurisdictions (50 states + DC) from BLS QCEW (Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages). Provides state-level compensation data for understanding regional wage differences, cost-of-living adjustments, and economic competitiveness analysis.

partitionedTables.name: metro_industry
partitionedTables.comment: Employment by industry sector for 27 major U.S. metropolitan areas across 22 NAICS supersector codes. Covers major metros including NYC, LA, Chicago, Houston, and others with detailed industry breakdowns for manufacturing, retail, healthcare, financial activities, and government sectors. Enables metro-level industry analysis and cross-metro economic comparisons.

partitionedTables.name: metro_wages
partitionedTables.comment: Average weekly wages for 27 major U.S. metropolitan areas from BLS QCEW (Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages). Provides metro-level compensation data for understanding local wage differences, cost-of-living adjustments, and metropolitan economic competitiveness analysis.

partitionedTables.name: county_qcew
partitionedTables.comment: County-level employment and wages from BLS QCEW (Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages) for all ~3,142 U.S. counties. Comprehensive data includes establishment counts, employment levels, total wages, and average weekly wages by industry (NAICS codes) and ownership type (private, federal, state, local government). Enables detailed county-level labor market analysis, industry concentration studies, and regional economic development research.

columns.name: own_code
columns.comment: Ownership code (private, federal, state, local government)

partitionedTables.name: county_wages
partitionedTables.comment: Average weekly wages for all 6,038 U.S. counties from BLS QCEW (Quarterly Census of Employment and Wages). Most granular geographic wage data available, enabling county-level compensation analysis, local labor market studies, and rural-urban wage comparisons. Essential for detailed regional economic analysis.

partitionedTables.name: jolts_regional
partitionedTables.comment: Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) data for 4 U.S. Census regions (Northeast, Midwest, South, West). Tracks job openings rate, hires rate, total separations rate, quits rate, and layoffs/discharges rate. Provides critical insights into labor market dynamics, worker mobility, and regional employment trends.

columns.name: metric_type
columns.comment: JOLTS metric (hires, separations, openings, quits, layoffs)

partitionedTables.name: jolts_state
partitionedTables.comment: Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) data for all 51 U.S. jurisdictions (50 states + DC). Tracks job openings rate, hires rate, total separations rate, quits rate, and layoffs/discharges rate at state level. Provides state-specific insights into labor market dynamics, worker mobility, and employment trends for state-level policy analysis.

partitionedTables.name: wage_growth
partitionedTables.comment: Average hourly earnings, weekly earnings, and employment cost index by industry and occupation. Tracks wage growth trends and labor cost pressures.

columns.name: series_id
columns.comment: BLS series identifier for wage/earnings data

columns.name: employment_cost_index
columns.comment: Employment Cost Index measuring compensation costs

partitionedTables.name: regional_employment
partitionedTables.comment: State and metropolitan area employment statistics including unemployment rates, job growth, and labor force participation by geographic region.

partitionedTables.name: treasury_yields
partitionedTables.comment: Daily U.S. Treasury yield curve rates from 1-month to 30-year maturities. Includes nominal yields, TIPS yields, and yield curve shape indicators. Source: U.S. Treasury Direct API.

columns.name: yield_percent
columns.comment: Yield rate as a percentage (e.g., 4.25 for 4.25%)

columns.name: yield_type
columns.comment: Type of Treasury security (e.g., 'Treasury Bill', 'Treasury Note', 'Treasury Bond')

partitionedTables.name: federal_debt
partitionedTables.comment: U.S. federal debt statistics including total public debt, debt held by public, and intragovernmental holdings. Tracks debt levels, composition, and trends. Source: Treasury Fiscal Data API.

columns.name: debt_type
columns.comment: Type of federal debt (e.g., 'Total Public Debt Outstanding')

columns.name: amount_billions
columns.comment: Total debt amount in billions of dollars

columns.name: holder_category
columns.comment: Category of debt holder (always 'All' for total debt)

columns.name: debt_held_by_public
columns.comment: Portion of debt held by the public in billions of dollars

columns.name: intragovernmental_holdings
columns.comment: Intragovernmental debt holdings in billions of dollars

partitionedTables.name: world_indicators
partitionedTables.comment: International economic indicators from World Bank for major economies. Includes GDP, inflation, unemployment, government debt, and population statistics. Enables comparison of U.S. economic performance with global peers.

columns.name: indicator_code
columns.comment: World Bank indicator code (e.g., 'NY.GDP.MKTP.CD' for GDP)

columns.name: indicator_name
columns.comment: Full description of the World Bank indicator

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Indicator value for the given country and year

partitionedTables.name: fred_indicators
partitionedTables.comment: Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) time series including GDP, interest rates, monetary aggregates, and other key economic indicators.

columns.name: series_name
columns.comment: Descriptive name of the economic data series

partitionedTables.name: gdp_components
partitionedTables.comment: Detailed GDP components from BEA including consumption, investment, government spending, and net exports broken down by subcategories.

columns.name: table_id
columns.comment: BEA table identifier for GDP components

columns.name: line_number
columns.comment: Line number within the BEA table

columns.name: series_code
columns.comment: BEA series code for this component

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Component value in millions of dollars

partitionedTables.name: gdp_statistics
partitionedTables.comment: Quarterly and annual GDP growth rates, nominal and real GDP values.

columns.name: quarter
columns.comment: Quarter number (1-4) for quarterly data, null for annual data

columns.name: metric
columns.comment: GDP metric name (e.g., 'Nominal GDP', 'Real GDP', 'Personal Consumption')

columns.name: value
columns.comment: GDP value in millions of dollars

columns.name: seasonally_adjusted
columns.comment: Whether the data is seasonally adjusted ('Yes' or 'No')

partitionedTables.name: regional_income
partitionedTables.comment: State and regional personal income statistics from BEA Regional Economic Accounts. Includes total income, per capita income, and population by state.

columns.name: geo_fips
columns.comment: FIPS code for the geographic area (state or county)

columns.name: metric
columns.comment: Income metric type (e.g., 'Personal Income', 'Per Capita Income')

columns.name: line_code
columns.comment: BEA line code for the income statistic

columns.name: line_description
columns.comment: Description of the income line item

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Income value in thousands of dollars or dollars (depending on metric)

partitionedTables.name: state_gdp
partitionedTables.comment: State-level GDP statistics from BEA Regional Economic Accounts (SAGDP2N table). Provides both total GDP and per capita real GDP by state across all NAICS industry sectors.

columns.name: value
columns.comment: GDP value in millions of dollars

partitionedTables.name: trade_statistics
partitionedTables.comment: Detailed U.S. export and import statistics from BEA NIPA Table T40205B. Comprehensive breakdown of goods and services trade by category with calculated trade balances.

columns.name: table_id
columns.comment: BEA table identifier for trade statistics

columns.name: line_number
columns.comment: Line number within the BEA table

columns.name: line_description
columns.comment: Description of the trade statistic line item

columns.name: series_code
columns.comment: BEA series code for this trade statistic

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Trade value in millions of dollars

columns.name: trade_balance
columns.comment: Calculated trade balance (exports minus imports) in millions of dollars

partitionedTables.name: ita_data
partitionedTables.comment: International Transactions Accounts (ITA) from BEA providing balance of payments statistics. Includes trade balance, current account, capital account, and income balances.

columns.name: indicator
columns.comment: BEA indicator code for international transactions

columns.name: indicator_description
columns.comment: Full description of the ITA indicator

columns.name: area_or_country
columns.comment: Geographic area or country name for the transaction

columns.name: value
columns.comment: Transaction value in millions of dollars

columns.name: time_series_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for the time series

partitionedTables.name: industry_gdp
partitionedTables.comment: GDP by Industry data from BEA showing value added by NAICS industry sectors. Provides comprehensive breakdown of economic output by industry including agriculture, mining, manufacturing, services, and government sectors. Available at both annual and quarterly frequencies for detailed sectoral analysis.

columns.name: table_id
columns.comment: BEA table identifier for industry GDP data

columns.name: quarter
columns.comment: Quarter identifier (e.g., 'Q1', 'Q2') or empty for annual data

columns.name: value
columns.comment: GDP value for the industry in millions of dollars

columns.name: note_ref
columns.comment: Reference to footnotes or data quality notes

partitionedTables.name: reference_jolts_industries
partitionedTables.comment: JOLTS industry code reference table from BLS. Maps industry codes to human-readable industry names for JOLTS data (jolts_regional, jolts_state tables). Essential dimension table for decoding JOLTS industry classifications.

partitionedTables.name: reference_jolts_dataelements
partitionedTables.comment: JOLTS data element code reference table from BLS. Maps metric codes (JOR, HIR, QUR, TSR, LDR) to descriptions (Job Openings Rate, Hires Rate, etc.). Essential dimension table for understanding JOLTS metrics in jolts_regional and jolts_state tables.

partitionedTables.name: fred_data_series_catalog
partitionedTables.comment: Complete FRED economic data series catalog with 841,000+ series partitioned by category/frequency/source/status. Status partition separates 'active' (currently updated) from 'discontinued' (no longer updated) series. Includes series metadata, categories, descriptions, units, frequency, and search capabilities. Enables efficient querying for either current data or historical analysis with partitions for major economic categories (national_accounts, labor_markets, finance, prices, etc.). Updated daily from FRED API with comprehensive coverage of all available economic time series for discovery and programmatic access.

columns.name: title
columns.comment: Full descriptive title of the economic data series

columns.name: observation_start
columns.comment: Date of first available observation (ISO 8601 format)

columns.name: observation_end
columns.comment: Date of most recent observation (ISO 8601 format)

columns.name: seasonal_adjustment
columns.comment: Seasonal adjustment status (e.g., 'Seasonally Adjusted', 'Not Seasonally Adjusted')

columns.name: last_updated
columns.comment: Timestamp of last data update (ISO 8601 format)

columns.name: popularity
columns.comment: FRED popularity score indicating usage/interest level

columns.name: notes
columns.comment: Detailed description, methodology, and source information

columns.name: category_id
columns.comment: FRED category ID for hierarchical classification

columns.name: source_name
columns.comment: Name of originating agency/organization (e.g., 'U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics')

columns.name: series_status
columns.comment: Series status: 'active' (currently updated) or 'discontinued' (no longer updated)

foreignKeys.comment: Links state industry employment to geographic and demographic data for state-level analysis
Links state wage data to geographic and demographic data for regional compensation analysis
Links county QCEW employment and wage data to geographic county boundaries, enabling county name lookups and spatial analysis
Links county wage data to geographic and demographic data for granular regional compensation analysis and rural-urban wage comparisons
Links county wage data to state-level geography for state-aggregated analysis
Links state JOLTS data to geographic and demographic data for state-level labor market dynamics analysis
Links regional employment to state geography when area_code represents state-level data (state FIPS codes)
Links regional income to state geography for spatial analysis and demographic correlation (when geo_fips is state-level)
Links state GDP to geographic and demographic data for per capita analysis and regional economic comparisons

reference_jolts_industries.comment: Reference dimension table for JOLTS industry classifications

reference_jolts_dataelements.comment: Reference dimension table for JOLTS metric codes and descriptions

tables.name: interest_rate_spreads
tables.sql: SELECT date, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'DGS10' THEN value END) AS ten_year_yield, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'DGS3MO' THEN value END) AS three_month_yield, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'DGS10' THEN value END) - MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'DGS3MO' THEN value END) AS term_spread_10y_3m, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'DFF' THEN value END) AS fed_funds_rate, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'BAMLC0A0CM' THEN value END) AS corporate_spread_bps FROM fred_indicators WHERE series_id IN ('DGS10', 'DGS3MO', 'DFF', 'BAMLC0A0CM') GROUP BY date
tables.comment: Interest rate spreads and yield curve analytics. Columns: date (observation date), ten_year_yield (10Y Treasury constant maturity rate %), three_month_yield (3M T-Bill rate %), term_spread_10y_3m (yield curve spread, negative values historically precede recessions), fed_funds_rate (Federal Reserve policy rate %), corporate_spread_bps (investment grade corporate bond spread over Treasuries in basis points, widening indicates credit stress). Critical for recession forecasting, monetary policy analysis, and credit market health assessment.

tables.name: housing_indicators
tables.sql: SELECT date, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'HOUST' THEN value END) AS housing_starts, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'HOUST1F' THEN value END) AS single_family_starts, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'PERMIT' THEN value END) AS building_permits, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'EXHOSLUSM495S' THEN value END) AS existing_sales, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'CSUSHPISA' THEN value END) AS case_shiller_index, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'MSPUS' THEN value END) AS median_sale_price, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'MORTGAGE30US' THEN value END) AS mortgage_rate_30y, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'RRVRUSQ156N' THEN value END) AS rental_vacancy_rate FROM fred_indicators WHERE series_id IN ('HOUST', 'HOUST1F', 'PERMIT', 'EXHOSLUSM495S', 'CSUSHPISA', 'MSPUS', 'MORTGAGE30US', 'RRVRUSQ156N') GROUP BY date
tables.comment: Comprehensive housing market health dashboard. Columns: date, housing_starts (total new housing units started in thousands, annualized), single_family_starts (single-family housing starts subset in thousands), building_permits (authorized building permits in thousands, leading indicator), existing_sales (existing home sales in millions annualized), case_shiller_index (S&P CoreLogic Case-Shiller U.S. National Home Price Index), median_sale_price (median sales price of houses sold in USD), mortgage_rate_30y (30-year fixed rate mortgage average %), rental_vacancy_rate (percentage of rental units vacant). Essential for real estate analysis, construction sector tracking, and housing affordability assessment.

tables.name: monetary_aggregates
tables.sql: SELECT date, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'M1SL' THEN value END) AS m1_money_supply, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'M2SL' THEN value END) AS m2_money_supply, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'BOGMBASE' THEN value END) AS monetary_base, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'GDP' THEN value END) AS nominal_gdp, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'GDP' THEN value END) / NULLIF(MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'M2SL' THEN value END), 0) AS m2_velocity FROM fred_indicators WHERE series_id IN ('M1SL', 'M2SL', 'BOGMBASE', 'GDP') GROUP BY date
tables.comment: Federal Reserve monetary aggregates and velocity analysis. Columns: date, m1_money_supply (narrow money supply including currency and demand deposits in billions), m2_money_supply (broad money supply including M1 plus savings deposits and money market funds in billions), monetary_base (currency in circulation plus bank reserves in billions), nominal_gdp (gross domestic product in billions), m2_velocity (calculated as GDP/M2, measures money turnover rate, declining velocity may indicate liquidity hoarding). Critical for Federal Reserve policy analysis, inflation expectations, and monetary transmission mechanism assessment.

tables.name: business_indicators
tables.sql: SELECT date, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'INDPRO' THEN value END) AS industrial_production_index, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'TCU' THEN value END) AS capacity_utilization_pct, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'RSXFS' THEN value END) AS retail_sales_millions, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'TOTBKCR' THEN value END) AS bank_credit_billions, MAX(CASE WHEN series_id = 'DRTSCILM' THEN value END) AS lending_standards_net_pct FROM fred_indicators WHERE series_id IN ('INDPRO', 'TCU', 'RSXFS', 'TOTBKCR', 'DRTSCILM') GROUP BY date
tables.comment: Business cycle and economic activity dashboard. Columns: date, industrial_production_index (index of manufacturing and industrial output, 2017=100), capacity_utilization_pct (percentage of total industrial capacity in use, high values indicate potential inflation pressure), retail_sales_millions (advance retail sales in millions USD, excludes services, leading consumer spending indicator), bank_credit_billions (total credit extended by banks in billions, measure of lending activity), lending_standards_net_pct (net percentage of banks tightening lending standards, positive values indicate credit tightening). Essential for business cycle analysis, recession/expansion identification, and credit conditions monitoring.

tables.name: trade_balance_summary
tables.sql: SELECT year, quarter, line_description, SUM(CASE WHEN trade_type = 'exports' THEN value ELSE 0 END) AS total_exports, SUM(CASE WHEN trade_type = 'imports' THEN value ELSE 0 END) AS total_imports, SUM(CASE WHEN trade_type = 'trade_balance' THEN value ELSE 0 END) AS net_trade_balance FROM trade_statistics GROUP BY year, quarter, line_description
tables.comment: U.S. international trade balance aggregated by category from BEA. Columns: year (calendar year), quarter (Q1-Q4), line_description (trade category such as 'Goods', 'Services', 'Foods feeds and beverages', etc.), total_exports (sum of exports in millions USD), total_imports (sum of imports in millions USD), net_trade_balance (exports minus imports, negative indicates trade deficit). Derived from BEA international transactions accounts (Table 1.2), enables analysis of trade composition, bilateral balances, and sectoral trade patterns. Critical for understanding U.S. competitiveness, currency impacts, and GDP contribution from net exports.
